intro: Acosta aggregata, commonly known as the clustered acosta, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
